Package com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.goods

Class PricedGood

java.lang.Object
com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.goods.PricedGood
All Implemented Interfaces:
Sellable, SellableItem
public class PricedGood
extends java.lang.Object
implements SellableItem
Generic implementation of a sellable Good, with its price for a specific region.
Author:
Andrew

  • Method Details

    • getGood

      public Good getGood()
      Returns:
      the good object (without price), cannot be null

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Description copied from interface: SellableItem
      Get the name of the product or service. A collection of sellable items doesn't require a label, but a specific item does.
      Specified by:
      getName in interface SellableItem
      Returns:
      The name of the product or service.

    • getRegionOfOrigin

      public com.ibm.icu.util.Region getRegionOfOrigin()
      Description copied from interface: SellableItem
      Get the region of origin for this item.

      TODO: SOLID design principles would suggest this should probably be split out in to a separate interface. I can foresee many future implementations of sellable items for which the region of origin is not needed.

      Specified by:
      getRegionOfOrigin in interface SellableItem
      Returns:
      the region of origin of the good, could be null

    • getRegionOfSale

      public com.ibm.icu.util.Region getRegionOfSale()
      Description copied from interface: Sellable
      Get the geographical region in which the sale is taking place. The same good or service can be sold for different prices in different countries or states or regions. Or might be available for sale in some regions, but not others. So we require that all sellable items or collections of items have a geographical region of sale attached to them.
      Specified by:
      getRegionOfSale in interface Sellable
      Returns:
      the region where the good can be sold at this price, cannot be null

    • getPrice

      public org.joda.money.Money getPrice()
      Description copied from interface: Sellable
      The basic price of the item or collection of items in this region. This would represent the pre-tax price, after-tax prices are added by the Taxable interface.
      Specified by:
      getPrice in interface Sellable
      Returns:
      the shelf price of the good in this region, cannot be null (but could be 0)

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Prefixes the Good's label with "imported" if the Good's region of origin is outside the region of sale for this price
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the display string for this priced good

    • getPrimaryKey

      public java.lang.String getPrimaryKey()
      This is a hack, in the real world each price would likely have a unique key defined in the data source
      Returns:
      a string that uniquely identifies this Good/Region pairing
